definition[0]: to force someone out of a position of power, especially so that you can take their place
example[0]: The Communists were finally ousted from power.
definition[1]: to force someone to leave a job or important position
example[1]: Profit margins collapsed and Martinez was ousted as chairman.
example[2]: two top executives who had been ousted from the board
definition[2]: if one company or product ousts another from its market position, it becomes more successful
example[3]: Cotton eventually ousted wool from its dominant role in clothing production.
